raw_text:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEXANDER CITY DIVISION
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
)
PLAINTIFF )
)
v. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
)
DEFENDANT )
PLAINTIFF’S/DEFENDANT’S CONSOLIDATED INTERROGATORIES AND
REQUESTS FOR PRODUCTION TO DEFENDANT/PLAINTIFF
COMES now the Plaintiff, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his attorney of
record, Dianne James Davis, and propounds the following interrogatories and requests for
production to the Defendant, Brittany Michelle Gilliland, separately and severally, in the manner
and form prescribed by law.
INSTRUCTIONS
Interrogatories are to be answered under oath notice must be filed with the Clerk of Court.
Materials to be produced may be copies and attached with your answers to these
interrogatories.
In answering these interrogatories, furnish all information available to you including
information in the possession of your attorney, any investigators and all persons acting on your
behalf. If you cannot answer the interrogatories in full after exercising due diligence to secure
the information, so state and answer to the extent possible, specifying your inability to answer
the remainder and stating whatever information or knowledge you have concerning the
unanswered portions.
If in response to this discovery any party fails to disclose any facts or other discoverable
information and then at a later date discloses such facts or information, please state how the
existence of these additional facts or information was “discovered”, by whom such additional
facts or information were “discovered”, when such additional facts or information were
“discovered”, who made the decision to disclose such facts or information in response to this
discovery, when that decision was made, and in detail, why such additional facts or information
was not disclosed in the parties initial responses.
If the information requested is not available to the party to whom this discovery is
directed, said party is requested to state all efforts made to obtain said information and from what
source such information might be obtained, if known to said party.
These interrogatories shall be deemed continuing, and the party to whom they are
addressed shall be obligated to change, supplement, and amend their answers as required by the
Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure.
1) Are you currently married? If so, please provide a true copy of your marriage
certificate.
2) Do you have any information, knowledge, or belief that the children have been
abused, neglected, frightened, not well cared for or exposed to immoral behavior
while in the other parent’s care and custody or anyone else residing in that
parent’s household? If so, give the details of each such incident or event, the date,
and the names and addresses of any witnesses.
3) Please provide the following information regarding your current residence:
a. Address;
b. Type of residence (i.e., house, apartment, mobile home, number of
bedrooms, bathrooms, etc.);
c. The names and ages of every other individual who resides at your
current residence and your relationship to each; and
d. The sleeping arrangements for each household member when
either minor child is at your residence overnight.
4) Please list in detail any and all communications you have had with the minor
children’s schools, teachers, counselors, or administrators regarding the Plaintiff,
in the past two (2) years, including the content and purpose of each
communication.
5) Please provide all documents, emails, text messages, or written communication
between you and any of the children’s teachers, principals, counselors, or
administrators, regarding the Plaintiff.
6) Please provide a copy of any police reports you have filed against the Plaintiff in
the past twenty-four (24) months to the present.
7) Please provide copies of your paycheck stubs or other proof of your income for
the last six (6) months.
8) Please provide a true and correct copy of your state and federal income tax returns
for the past two (2) years (in the event that a return has not been filed for a given
year, a copy of any estimate, request for extension, or any other form filed by you
or received by you from the Internal Revenue Service for the year in question),
including, but not limited to all W-2s, 1099s, schedules, itemizations forms,
worksheets, and other documents used or made in the computation of the tax
return.
9) In the past three (3) years, have the police or any law enforcement agency been
called to any location in connection with you, or has a law enforcement or police
incident report been made by you or against you by another person? If so, provide
the following information for each incident:
a. Date of incident;
b. Reporting person's name;
c. Alleged suspect’s name;
d. A brief statement as to what gave rise to the incident including, but
not limited to, the allegation made, crime alleged, and explanation, if any
disposition (e.g., arrest and conviction/probation; arrest and dismissal
upon taking classes; no arrest, made me leave residence; no warrant
signed; case still pending);
e. Provide a copy of all police reports related to each incident.
10) Have you or anyone residing in your household ever been arrested or convicted of
any crimes, misdemeanors, or traffic infractions? If your answer is in the
affirmative, please state the nature of each charge, the jurisdiction, and whether
you were convicted or any penalties were imposed.
11) Please state what method or methods of discipline you use or have used on the
minor children. Do you now or have you ever used corporal punishment as a
means of disciplining your children?
12) Please state if you, or anyone known to you, have ever hit, threatened, injured,
mistreated, molested, or otherwise subjected your children to physical, verbal, or
mental abuse. If so, please state what you (or anyone else) did, the date or dates
of the abuse and the circumstances of the conduct.
13) Please list any and all occasions or time periods in which you chose not to
participate in your scheduled visitation with either of the minor children, giving
the reasons for your failure and/or refusal to exercise said visitation.
14) For the statements in your pleadings wherein you allege that the Plaintiff has
attempted to alienate the children from you, has actively hindered communication
with the minor children’s schools, and has been manipulating the children’s
perception of you, please provide the following:
a. The factual basis of your allegations;
b. The name, address and telephone number of any person who can
corroborate any of your allegations; and
c. Provide a copy of any photos, audio/video recordings, records, text
messages, emails, correspondence, or other physical evidence that
supports your allegations.
15) Do you, or anyone residing in your household, consume alcoholic beverages,
narcotic drugs, or controlled substances in the presence of the minor children? If
so, please state the date(s), the identity of the person(s) involved, and the
circumstances of each occasion.
16) Have you, or anyone residing in your household, ever driven a vehicle in which
the minor children were occupants while under the influence of alcohol and/or
drugs? If so, state the date and circumstances of each occasion.
17) Please list all steps, if any, that you have taken to improve your relationship with
the minor child, A.K., in the last eighteen (18) months.
18) Please identify all activities or events of the minor child, A.K., of which are
aware, that you have failed to attend in the past two (2) years, and provide the
reasons for your absence from each.
19) Please state whether you, or any third party at your request, have ever recorded
and conversations, interactions, or communications involving the Plaintiff and/or
minor children. If so, provide the date and location of the each recording, as well
as the substance of each and the name of the person doing the recording.
20) Please state whether you have failed or refused to attend any of the weekly
family dinners, including Sunday dinners, with the minor children as ordered by
the Court. If so, identify each date you failed or refused to attend, the reason for
your absence, and whether you notified the other parent in advance.
21) Please state every instance in which either of the minor children has operated or
ridden as a passenger on an ATV, four-wheeler, or similar vehicle without wearing
a helmet or other protective gear. For each instance, identify the date, locations,
and circumstances, and state why a helmet or protective gear was not used.
22) Please describe in detail how you have been involved in the children's education.
Specially list all educational concerns you have about the children, all parent-
teacher conferences you have attended, and detail any difficulties you have had
communicating with the other parent regarding the children's educational needs.
23) Prior to the first reunification session on December 12, 2023, state whether you
had any contact with Kelly Turler, including but not limited to meetings, phone
calls, emails or other communications. Identify whether you met privately with
Kelly Turner before A.K. was allowed into the room during the first session, and
for each such interaction, describe the date, manner of communication, subject
discussed, and whether the Plaintiff or A.K. were present. In addition, state what
qualifications in reunification therapy Kelly Turner had that led you to select her
as the reunification therapist in this matter.
24) Has the Department of Human Resources, Social Services, Child Protective
Services, or any other government agency ever investigated an abuse or neglect
claim against you or any other person residing in your household? If so, please
provide the following for each such claim:
a. The identity of the entity or agency;
b. The date of the claim;
c. A description of the offense;
d. The outcome of the matter;
e. Any punishment or consequence to the person against who the
claim was made (you received); and
f. The name and address of any other person with knowledge of the
facts stated in your response to this interrogatory.
25) Please provide the name and address of each person who has knowledge of the
facts or events referenced in the pleadings or in any answers to these
interrogatories, or who may testify at any proceeding in this matter. For each
person, provide their name, address, telephone number, and the subject matter of
their anticipated testimony.
26) Please produce a copy of any photograph, surveillance footage, audio or video
recording, text message, social media post, screenshot, tangible item, and any and
all written matter, including electronically stored information, that relates directly
or indirectly to the issues in this matter or that you intend to use during the trial of
this matter.
27) Have you been advised that your answers are made under oath, may be used as
material testimony in the event of a trial or hearing, and must be updated if your
foregoing responses change?
Submitted this the 16th day of September, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via the
AlaCourt E-File System and/or by electronic transmission on this the 16th day of September,
2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel
